content:
Hey @Taylor Cramer -- in the async-await beta blog post, I wrote:

  • the 0.3.0 version of the [futures-rs library][futures] will support
    async-await and will be released by the time async-await hits stable
    (you can use the [0.3.0-alpha][] releases now);

I don't see 0.3.0 yet -- is this still the plan?
I'm going to do a triage of the futures-rs repo issue list this afternoon and add things to the 0.3 milestone (https://github.com/rust-lang-nursery/futures-rs/milestone/2) as appropriate
with a plan to resolve open issues and release at the beginning of next week
let me know if there are other concerns or folks I should be coordinating with
0.3.0 has been published. I'll follow up with a blog post announcement soon, perhaps @nikomatsakis wants to coordinate with their async/await announcement?
@nikomatsakis btw; how is the blog post coming along? The release announcement needs a link :P https://github.com/rust-lang/blog.rust-lang.org/pull/444/files#r342849495
I'm off to bed, I pushed the last few edits; @Pietro Albini had wanted to post them simultaneoudly. I did update the post to mention the 0.3.0 release of futures, @Taylor Cramer
I did some "prediction" of the URL for the async post in the release post :slight_smile:
let me rename the file... :stuck_out_tongue:

Fantastic work on this release, everyone! I'm jumping into the work with actix to convert to futures 0.3 but I'd love to start being an active member here as well. Curious what the process is for joining this working group?

@Christian Battaglia right now the main thing we are doing is polish -- in which case the process is basically to dive in and fix some bugs. We do have a weekly sync meeting on Tuesdays (see the compiler team calendar) which could be a good place to show up, but we can also chat async.

:wave:
Hello everyone! I'm new here...
I'm a former classical musician, Brazilian, graduated in San Francisco as Software Engineer, currently working from Paris, FR as SRE.
I would love to find a way to get involved in this awesome community
Looking forward to meet some of you in the next weekly meeting! :crab:
